Statements: This is not a showcase. This is a stewardship.
Every file here reflects my effort to make truth traceable, learning inheritable, and dignity non-negotiable.
Let the documentation be as transparent as the protocol, and as dignified as the people it serves.
Each folder is a governance layer.
Each module is a traceable artifact.
Each file is designed for inheritance — not display.
WhyThisExists: This is a constitutional sanctuary — built for those who were never meant to be forgotten.
I am MJ Ahmad. I do not seek employment. I seek understanding.
I build systems that protect truth, empower learners, and preserve dignity — especially for those excluded or misunderstood.

WhoIAm.StewardshipIdentity: MJ Ahmad — Steward of Ethical Inheritance
WhoIAm.Belief: Every human deserves dignity, regardless of religion, race, gender, or origin.
WhoIAm.Method: Documentation, scripting, and constitutional clarity as tools of justice.

Philosophy: Every script must be transparent. Every action must be verifiable. Every contributor must be dignified.
I build for the inheritors, not the employers. My work is a legacy, not a résumé.

Projects.Name: Quraner Fariwala
Projects.TagLine: Research • Printing • Distribution of Holy Quran
Projects.ShortDescription: Quraner Fariwala is a dedicated institution in Bangladesh, established not for personal gain but for the welfare of humanity, the satisfaction of the Creator, and the spiritual peace of society. It prevents misinterpretation of the Quran, ensures accurate transmission of its message, and stops the misuse of the Holy Quran as a mere means of livelihood. By bridging Quranic education, technology, and real-world knowledge, it seeks to eliminate misinformation, social inequality, and cultural distortions while nurturing an enlightened future generation.
Mission: Preserve, publish, and distribute the Holy Quran with integrity.
Provide memorization-friendly Qurans for non-Arabic Hifz students with scholarly accuracy and guidance.
Prevent cultural misuse of the Quran and promote correct understanding.
Empower young Hifz students with pathways to higher education and leadership.
Build a transparent, inheritable system that serves humanity for generations.
Vision: Establish Quraner Fariwala as a timeless institution of Quranic stewardship.
Ensure memorization-friendly Qurans are accessible to every non-Arabic Hifz student worldwide.
Harmonize Quranic education with modern knowledge, technology, and socio-economic empowerment.
Eliminate misinformation and cultural distortions that separate Quranic learning from real-life education.
Nurture a generation of enlightened leaders who combine Quranic wisdom with worldly knowledge.

Projects.Name: Bangladesh GEO Stewardship (BGS)
Projects.TagLine: Preserving Our Earth’s Memory, Empowering Our Nation’s Future
Projects.ShortDescription: Bangladesh GEO Stewardship (BGS) is a constitutional movement and observatory initiative to preserve Earth’s ecological and geospatial archives and to empower future generations with exclusion-proof, child-readable, inheritable systems. BGS treats canonical datasets as national inheritance and designs systems that are transparent, auditable, and accessible.
Mission: Safeguard canonical datasets and observatories as national inheritance.
Provide universal, child-readable access to geospatial and ecological knowledge.
Align Bangladesh’s stewardship with global institutions (USGS, NASA, ESA, Rubin Observatory).
Enshrine justice, equality, and dignity in all archival artifacts.
Vision: Position Bangladesh as a global benchmark for civic-tech stewardship by 2030.
Enshrine national GEO archives as constitutional sanctuaries by 2040.
Harmonize Earth’s memory with humanity’s future by 2050.
Create exclusion-proof, inheritable geospatial and ecological archives accessible to all generations.

Projects.Name: Solutions for Real-Bangladesh Challenges (SRBC)
Projects.TagLine: Real Solutions, Real Stewardship, Real Bangladesh.
Projects.ShortDescription: Solutions for Real-Bangladesh Challenges (SRBC) is a stewardship-driven initiative designing ethical, inheritable, and audit-ready systems to address Bangladesh’s social, environmental, and infrastructural challenges. SRBC combines modular technology, transparent documentation, and community empowerment to create sustainable, inheritable solutions.
Mission: Architect inheritable, exclusion-proof systems addressing Bangladesh’s real challenges.
Ensure every solution is transparent, audit-ready, and globally accessible.
Combine modular technology, documentation, and community empowerment for sustainable impact.
Vision: A Bangladesh empowered by modular, ethical, and sustainable solutions.
Every citizen and institution can inherit systems of justice, stewardship, and accountability.
Scale local pilots into national, inheritable public goods.

Timeline.Description: Comprehensive, task-level timeline for recovery, documentation, negotiation, fundraising, operations, MCP network, consolidation, and sustainability. Each Phase contains Tasks with independent statuses to allow granular progress tracking and automatic percentage calculation.

Tasks.Description: Collect names, phone numbers, amounts, and dates of all creditors and investors.
Verify verbal agreements and convert them into written records (notes of conversation, claimed terms).
Assign unique CreditorID for each entry and capture supporting evidence (screenshots, bank references).
Save creditor list into D:\\mj.dev\\docs\\creditors\\creditors-list.json with backup copy.
Collect names, phone numbers, amounts, invoice references, and order details for all advance payments.
Verify each payment against receipts, bank transactions, or mobile payment logs.
Assign unique OrderID for each advance order and capture any customer notes or promises.
Save orders list into D:\\mj.dev\\docs\\orders\\orders-list.json with backup copy.
Ensure creditors and orders lists are stored in separate folders and verify folder permissions.
Create encrypted backup copies and an offline printout for immediate reference.
Prepare a formal apology letter template in Bengali and English (concise, accountable, solution-oriented).
Prepare an Arabic version of the apology template for international donors where applicable.
Customize apology letters for high-priority creditors (mentioning specific amounts and proposed settlement options).
Customize apology letters for advance order customers (offer refund or prioritized delivery options).
Send apology messages to creditors via SMS/WhatsApp/phone and record delivery status.
Send apology messages to advance order customers and offer clear next steps (refund or delivery timeline).
Save copies of all communications in D:\\mj.dev\\docs\\communications\\apology-letters\\ with timestamps.
Create a communication log file with date, recipient, method, and short summary of message.
Track responses from creditors and customers in a structured response list and tag priority cases.
Update MJTimeline.json with progress for each communication task and note blockers.

Phases.Title: Negotiation & Settlement
Phases.Goal: Reduce creditor pressure and establish clear settlement agreements within 7 days.

Tasks.Description: Identify creditors requiring urgent negotiation and prioritize by amount and pressure level.
Prepare a negotiation strategy document with proposed timelines, partial payments, and supply options.
Schedule direct discussions (phone or in-person) with prioritized creditors and record meeting times.
Conduct negotiations, document agreed terms, and obtain verbal confirmations where possible.
Draft bilingual settlement agreements (Bengali + English) tailored to each creditor's terms.
Include clauses for repayment upon recovery, Quran supply options, and dispute resolution steps.
Save signed agreements in D:\\mj.dev\\docs\\communications\\settlement-agreements\\ and create backups.
Maintain a negotiation log with creditor name, date, summary, agreed terms, and next action.
Track creditor compliance with agreed interim terms and update MJTimeline.json accordingly.
Send confirmation messages to creditors after agreements are signed and store confirmations.

Phases.Title: Fundraising & Support
Phases.Goal: Collect cash donations and secure financial support before the end of Ramadan.

Tasks.Description: Create a list of potential donors including madrasas, ulema, businessmen, and community leaders.
Categorize donors by type (individual, institutional, business, religious) and priority.
Prepare a concise donation proposal in English highlighting purpose, impact, and urgent needs.
Translate and adapt the proposal into Bengali for local donors and community outreach.
Translate and adapt the proposal into Arabic for international or Arabic-speaking donors.
Contact at least 5 donors daily via phone, email, or personal visits and record outcomes.
Record donor responses in D:\\mj.dev\\docs\\fundraising\\donor-list.json with date and commitment amount.
Save all proposals and outreach templates in D:\\mj.dev\\docs\\fundraising\\donation-proposals\\.
Maintain a fundraising log with daily outreach summary, pledges, and received amounts.
Send thank-you messages and receipts to donors who commit or transfer funds.
Update MJTimeline.json with completed fundraising tasks and percentage progress.

Phases.Title: Restart Operations
Phases.Goal: Restart operations towards the end of Ramadan with clear, documented steps.

Tasks.Description: Identify printing press options, request quotes, and negotiate initial printing costs for a small batch.
Finalize Quran manuscript with all markings, research notes, and corrections for print-ready files.
Approve proof copy and start printing a small test batch of Qurans for quality verification.
Document printing plan and cost breakdown in D:\\mj.dev\\docs\\operations\\printing-plan.docx.
Deliver Qurans to advance order clients first and collect delivery confirmations.
